Blockchain: A distributed ledger technology that records transactions across multiple computers, ensuring transparency and security.
Cryptocurrency: Digital currency that operates on blockchain technology without central authority, like Bitcoin and Ethereum.
Smart Contracts: Self-executing contracts with terms written in code, automatically enforcing agreements on blockchain.
DeFi: Decentralized Finance - financial services using blockchain without traditional intermediaries.
Stablecoin: Cryptocurrency designed to maintain stable value by pegging to fiat currency or assets.
Tokenization: Converting real-world assets into digital tokens on blockchain for trading and ownership.
Fintech: Financial technology companies offering digital financial services and innovations.
Digital Banking: Banking services delivered through digital platforms instead of physical branches.
API Integration: Connecting different software systems to share data and functionality seamlessly.
Payment Gateway: Technology enabling online payment processing between buyers and sellers.
KYC: Know Your Customer - verification process to confirm customer identity and prevent fraud.
AML: Anti-Money Laundering - procedures to detect and prevent illegal financial activities.
Risk Management: Identifying, analyzing, and mitigating financial and operational risks.
Portfolio Management: Managing investment collections to optimize returns and minimize risk.
Robo-Advisor: Automated investment platform using algorithms to manage portfolios.
Cryptocurrency Wallet: Digital storage for holding, sending, and receiving cryptocurrencies securely.
Peer-to-Peer Lending: Direct lending between individuals without traditional financial institutions.
Mobile Banking: Banking services accessed through mobile applications and smartphones.
Fintech Regulation: Rules and guidelines governing financial technology companies and services.
Open Banking: Financial data sharing through APIs, allowing third-party developers to build services.
